text: playing around with the idea of making an up to date HubL language extension for VSCode. thoughts anyone?
there is one on the marketplace but it’s from 2 years ago
I think you should do it :stuck_out_tongue:
but for real, if you need help, I'd be happy to contribute where I can

<@UDC6ATL20> Yes please - if you could make it work with hubl variables in .css files that would be great :stuck_out_tongue: a bit frustrating seeing red lines down my css files where hubl variables are referenced.
I'd be happy to help where I can also
Yes that doesn’t sound out of the picture! MVP in my mind would be syntax highlighting and snippets from the documentation so I can stay sane.

<@UDC6ATL20> I’d recommend throwing up a github and creating a slack channel for it. Once you have some issues on your github request help from people in <#CCQ7H31D5|developer-tools>

People love to help, but if there aren’t issues clearly explaining what work needs to be done they don’t know how to help and worry about breaking your stuff.

Sounds good folks - I wanted to gauge the interest. I’ll get started and post to <#CCQ7H31D5|developer-tools> and <http://integrate.HubSpot.com|integrate.HubSpot.com> when I get the repo up and running!

A HubL language extension would be really nice. I’m sure there’s one for Jinja you could adapt without many changes. Where did you find the existing one? The only one I could find was <https://github.com/magn3tic/HubSpot-Hubl-Snippets>
if it would be nice if there was something that could compile a combo of sass and hubl
If the DM code editor could do that I would lose my mind.
that is precisely why I like to build stuff in codepen then pull it over to HS after
then you get to use all the tools you want like sass, then get to play with hubl vars and whatnot
I’m stoked for when I can start really relying on css custom properties
_cough cough cough_ emmet _cough cough cough_
I could set them with hubL and get all the benefits from both without mixing them in my files
i often work locally in sublime and push up via ftp. i would love to be able to put the hubl macros on my local build so when i need to update someday in the future, i can via HubSpot design manager
If you want to go the full mile: <https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/>
I still wanna make the extension inject emmet capability in - just haven’t had time to really dive into it
but i love codepen.
would really be cool if HubDB had a way to uncheck/check all boolean fields in a column
Are we not able to upload folders into the file manager? Trying to export some Ceros experiences and host them in HubSpot but can't upload any of the folders that I need to reference
<@UDFSF3N1F> Use a FTP connection
Sorry Reg, do you mean this? <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/HubSpot-ftp>
Yes
You can upload folders to the file manager via the FTP. That's how we did our Ceros project.
got it, I'll give it a shot. Thanks!
spoiler alert: It takes awhile to upload everything though :wink:
oh boy, guess I'll grab a bag of popcorn for this
